docs.abstract: Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller once shouted from the sidelines. Now they’re the driving force behind the policy separating immigrant children from parents.
docs.snippet: Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller once shouted from the sidelines. Now they’re the driving force behind the policy separating immigrant children from parents.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jeff Sessions and Stephen Miller spent years on the political fringe in the nation’s capital as high-decibel immigration hard-liners, always warning about the dangers of open borders but rarely in a position to affect law or policy.

headline.main: How Anti-Immigration Passion Was Inflamed From the Fringe
headline.print_headline: How Anti-Immigration Passion Was Inflamed From the Fringe

byline.original: By Michael D. Shear and Katie Benner

docs.abstract: President Trump has raised fears that he is tearing at the credibility of some of the most important institutions in American life to save himself.
docs.snippet: President Trump has raised fears that he is tearing at the credibility of some of the most important institutions in American life to save himself.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the days before the 2016 election, Donald J. Trump expressed “great respect” for the “courage” of the F.B.I. and Justice Department for reopening the investigation into Hillary Clinton’s private email server. Sixteen months later, he has changed his mind.

headline.main: Trump’s Unparalleled War on a Pillar of Society: Law Enforcement

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Sharon LaFraniere, Katie Benner and Peter Baker

docs.abstract: Here are some of the key highlights, with analysis, of the indictment of the Russian agents and excerpts from Mr. Rosenstein’s announcement on Friday.
docs.snippet: Here are some of the key highlights, with analysis, of the indictment of the Russian agents and excerpts from Mr. Rosenstein’s announcement on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rod J. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, on Friday announced new charges against 12 Russian military intelligence officers accused of hacking the Democratic National Committee, the Clinton presidential campaign and the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee.

headline.main: 12 Russians Charged: Major Highlights of the Indictment and Rod Rosenstein’s Statement

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: House lawmakers voted to preserve the National Security Agency’s warrantless surveillance program.
docs.snippet: House lawmakers voted to preserve the National Security Agency’s warrantless surveillance program.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House of Representatives voted on Thursday to extend the National Security Agency’s warrantless surveillance program for six years with minimal changes, rejecting a push by a bipartisan group of lawmakers to impose significant privacy limits when it sweeps up Americans’ emails and other personal communications.

headline.main: House Extends Surveillance Law, Rejecting New Privacy Safeguards
headline.print_headline: House Renews N.S.A. Powers Of Surveillance

byline.original: By Charlie Savage, Eileen Sullivan and Nicholas Fandos

docs.abstract: Mr. Trump tweeted that a confidential informant embedded in his presidential campaign would be a scandal bigger than Watergate, inviting comparisons.
docs.snippet: Mr. Trump tweeted that a confidential informant embedded in his presidential campaign would be a scandal bigger than Watergate, inviting comparisons.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump asserted on Thursday that federal investigators attempted to infiltrate his 2016 campaign with a confidential informant — a scandalous overreach, he said, that would be “bigger than Watergate!”

headline.main: Trump Says Russia Inquiry’s Overreach Is a Scandal ‘Bigger Than Watergate!’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: “I’m a big, big believer in freedom of the press,” Mr. Trump said. “But I’m also a believer in classified information. It has to remain classified.”
docs.snippet: “I’m a big, big believer in freedom of the press,” Mr. Trump said. “But I’m also a believer in classified information. It has to remain classified.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday praised the arrest of a former Senate Intelligence Committee aide who is accused of lying to investigators about his contacts with reporters in an inquiry into leaks of classified information.

headline.main: Trump Praises Arrest of Former Senate Committee Aide in Leaks Inquiry

byline.original: By Eileen Sullivan and Katie Benner

docs.abstract: President Trump said on Twitter that he wished he had chosen another good lawyer to be his attorney general.
docs.snippet: President Trump said on Twitter that he wished he had chosen another good lawyer to be his attorney general.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Wednesday that he wished he had chosen another lawyer to be his attorney general, instead of Jeff Sessions, who recused himself from the Russia investigation early in the Trump administration.

headline.main: Trump Again Says He Wishes Sessions Were Not Attorney General
headline.print_headline: Trump Says, ‘I Wish I Did’ Snub Sessions For Cabinet

docs.abstract: The president praised his approach, and criticized Democrats, in a series of tweets on Monday following a three-day negotiation session that ended with little clarity.
docs.snippet: The president praised his approach, and criticized Democrats, in a series of tweets on Monday following a three-day negotiation session that ended with little clarity.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump defended his administration’s approach to resolving a trade war with China in a series of tweets Monday, following three days of negotiations with the Chinese that ended with little clarity.

headline.main: Trump Defends Administration’s Trade Strategy With China
headline.print_headline: Online and on TV, Mixed Messages and a Defense of Economic Strategy

byline.original: By Eileen Sullivan and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: In a trio of tweets early Friday, Mr. Trump said Canadian tariffs on American dairy products were “Not fair to our farmers!”
docs.snippet: In a trio of tweets early Friday, Mr. Trump said Canadian tariffs on American dairy products were “Not fair to our farmers!”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump railed on Friday against Canadian tariffs on American dairy products as he prepared to travel to Canada, where he is likely to be greeted with an icy welcome ahead of a financial summit meeting with longtime American allies.

headline.main: Ahead of G-7 Summit Meeting, Trump Rails Against Canadian Tariffs

docs.abstract: The new designation is separate from the nuclear sanctions that were reinstated last week against Iran.
docs.snippet: The new designation is separate from the nuclear sanctions that were reinstated last week against Iran.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration accused the head of Iran’s central bank of funneling money to Hezbollah and designated him as a global terrorist on Tuesday, placing further financial constraints on Tehran a week after President Trump called for reimposing sanctions that were lifted as part of an Obama-era nuclear deal.

headline.main: U.S. Imposes New Sanctions on Iran, Designating Head of Central Bank a Terrorist
headline.print_headline: Bank Official Is the Target Of Sanctions Against Iran
